Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "306", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/694264341807130330/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "2465876379736274865", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2017-04-23T00:05:00+05:30", "updated": "2019-04-21T08:16:12+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNTU1ODE0NzcyNzc5Cm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/04/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_23.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/2465876379736274865", "title": "SANATANA DHARMA , HINDUISM EXHUMED AND RESURRECTED, PART 81 - CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">THIS POST IS CONTINUED FROM PART 80, BELOW--</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/04/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_22.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/04/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_22.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gyana means knowledge.\nGyana Yoga is the path where reality is discovered through insight, practice\nand knowledge. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gyana Yoga has four\nprinciples:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Viveka - Discrimination<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vairagya - Renunciation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shatsampatti - The Six\nTreasures <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mumukshtva - Constant\nStriving for God<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">I have already written\nabout Shatsampatti in part 80</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">Now let me talk briefly\nabout <b style=\"background-color: white;\">VIVEKA</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-MoZFHgIogCE/WPuiYF7IniI/AAAAAAABS2E/EkkE2YlTV5AffEDjkHKQAwNMxHHB3zxVACLcB/s1600/imaoges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-MoZFHgIogCE/WPuiYF7IniI/AAAAAAABS2E/EkkE2YlTV5AffEDjkHKQAwNMxHHB3zxVACLcB/s1600/imaoges.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Viveka comes not from\nthe mind but from the inner being (soul)<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">The Sanskrit term for\nconscience is viveka. &nbsp;Conscience is the inner voice. &nbsp;It is the voice of the soul.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ANS8hDgImj0/WPuiE8tbmRI/AAAAAAABS2A/Gt51sYANlg0eMbUpzt4jLe5807jWhwGegCLcB/s1600/imag99es.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ANS8hDgImj0/WPuiE8tbmRI/AAAAAAABS2A/Gt51sYANlg0eMbUpzt4jLe5807jWhwGegCLcB/s1600/imag99es.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">By the application of\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b>viveka</b></span> (<span style=\"background-color: white;\">spiritual discrimination or discernment</span>) to life experience, the\naspirant gradually develops a strong attraction for the inner spiritual source\nof fulfillment and happiness and limited attachments fall away naturally</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Viveka is the faculty\nof judging, seeing right and wrong, and deciding between the two.&nbsp; He who is able to control his mind by his\nintellect-that is, control his desires by his faculty of making decisions and\ndiscrimination, progresses towards his goal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Viveka involved\nconscience.&nbsp; Conscience is a servant of\nthe individual\u2019s value system. An immature or weak value system produces a weak\nconscience, while a fully informed value system produces a strong sense of\nright and wrong.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conscience is doing what you believe is right even though it\nmight be unpopular, difficult, or dangerous.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conscience is the light\nof the soul that is burning within the chambers of your heart. It is the little\nspark of celestial fire, which makes known to you the presence of the\nindweller, the author of the divine laws of truth.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It raises the voice of\nprotest whenever anything is thought or done contrary to the interest of its master.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conscience is the voice\nof the Self which says \u2018yes or \u2018no\u2019 when you are involved in a moral struggle.\nIt raises the voice of protest whenever anything is thought of or done contrary\nto the interest of its master.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conscience is a form of\ntruth. It is the knowledge of our own acts and feelings of right or wrong. It\nis a sensitive balance to weigh actions. It is the faculty or principle by\nwhich we distinguish right from wrong.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a guiding voice from within. Sense\nof duty is conscience. Scrupulousness is conscience. Conscience is a silent\nteacher.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conscience is above\nreasoning and discussion. It is a dictatory command to plunge deep into the\ndepths of virtue, or to rise high above the level of vice. The positive\nelements, which adorn conscience, are truth, courage and justice.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conscience is the\nconsciousness of the moral worth of one\u2019s own conduct or motives together with\na feeling of obligation to do right or to be good. Conscience is a needle that\npoints steadily to the Pole Star of eternal justice.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conscience is your\npreceptor. It dictates to you: \u201cDo this action. It is right.\u201d It warns you\nalso: \u201cThis is wrong. Do not do this act.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conscience is a great\nledger book. All your offences are written and registered in this ledger. It is\na terrible witness. Conscience is the best minister of justice. It threatens,\npromises, rewards and punishes, and keeps all under its control. If conscience\nstings you once, it is an admonition; if twice, it is a condemnation. To act\nagainst conscience is to act against reason and divine law.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you do a wrong\naction, the conscience pricks you. You experience pinpricks. It says to you in\na clear, small, shrill voice, \u201cDo not do this wrong action, my friend. It will\nbring misery to you.\u201d A conscientious person at once ceases to act further, and\nbecomes wise.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conscience warns you\nlike a teacher or a friend, before it punishes as a judge. It tells you to do\nthe right. Cowardice asks: \u201cIs it safe?\u201d Avarice asks: \u201cIs there any gain in\nit?\u201d Vanity asks: \u201cCan I become famous?\u201d Lust asks: \u201cIs there pleasure?\u201d&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But\nConscience asks: \u201cIs it right?\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conscience prompts you\nto choose the right instead of the wrong, and tells you that you ought to do\nthe right. The first impulse of conscience is apt to be right.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If there are pinpricks\nand twists in the conscience, if there is a sense of shame, depression in the\nheart, know that you have done a wrong action. If there is exhilaration,\ncheerfulness, feel you have done a virtuous action.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conscience is obscured\nthrough human weakness. The faint inner voice of the spirit is stifled by the\nrumbling of emotional conflicts, base impulses and dictates of the flesh. It is\nawakened and sharpened to new clearness through purity of conduct and practice\nof ethical virtues.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through misuse, conscience\nbecomes blunt. Through abuse or misuse, it is even destroyed. Through\nwickedness, it becomes perverted. Uttering falsehood and taking bribes destroy\nthe conscience altogether.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-utKxpWUoF40/WPug4RG6ttI/AAAAAAABS1w/SGllq1hvfkYqjO_-DLheQAlFiClH4YUgQCLcB/s1600/im66ages.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-utKxpWUoF40/WPug4RG6ttI/AAAAAAABS1w/SGllq1hvfkYqjO_-DLheQAlFiClH4YUgQCLcB/s400/im66ages.png\" width=\"310\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A virtuous person alone\ncan use the instrument of conscience. He alone can clearly hear the inner voice\nof the soul. In a wicked person, this faculty becomes dead. The sensitive\nnature of conscience is destroyed by base actions or corruption. Hence he is\nnot able to discriminate right from wrong.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you do wrong actions\nand treat them lightly today, you will not hesitate to do serious crimes the\nnext day. If you allow one negative action to enter and dwell in your\nconscience, you certainly pave the way for the entry of a thousand more.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your\nconscience will become blunt. It will lose its sensitiveness. The habit of\ndoing evil deeds will pervade the whole body like the poison of the scorpion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If an honest person joins\nthe Customs , and begins to take bribe, for the first time he shudders. His\nconscience quivers and trembles. He feels a lot of uneasiness. If he repeats it\nagain several times, his conscience becomes blunt. He will not feel anything.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-jgSa2mlUn_E/WPugroGQ55I/AAAAAAABS1s/9cDrVIlwlT8pIl6qEimRec3LUfOgMKgNwCLcB/s1600/iomages.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-jgSa2mlUn_E/WPugroGQ55I/AAAAAAABS1s/9cDrVIlwlT8pIl6qEimRec3LUfOgMKgNwCLcB/s400/iomages.png\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The inner mechanism of conscience is very subtle. Keep it sensitive by doing\nvirtuous deeds only.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Keep the conscience\nalways bright and sharp by adhering to truth, dharma and virtue. It will be\nyour constant, elevating companion. Virtuous acts, charity, benevolence,\nnobility, generosity, acts of mercy and practice of truthfulness,&nbsp; ahimsa sharpen the conscience.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Food plays an important\nrole in the development of a pure conscience. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A person of clear\nconscience is ever pure, joyful and cheerful. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A man of guilty\nconscience is morose, cheerless.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">A person of pure and clean conscience gets good\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">REM sleep</span></b>&nbsp;and wakes up refreshed and happy.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-bSVUsbHkrdk/WPufkN6PXGI/AAAAAAABS1Y/zD6hbqHYOV4-qGbd58TKvn-4laejrX_PACLcB/s1600/d88ownload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-bSVUsbHkrdk/WPufkN6PXGI/AAAAAAABS1Y/zD6hbqHYOV4-qGbd58TKvn-4laejrX_PACLcB/s400/d88ownload.jpg\" width=\"298\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\">A person of guilty conscience is dead even\nwhile living. He hardly gets <b><span style=\"color: blue;\">REM sleep</span></b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><o:p></o:p></span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A person of pure conscience is a veritable god\non this earth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A clean conscience\ndiscerns evil quickly and shuns it. A good conscience bestows on you ease,\nserenity, joy and happiness. It prevents calamities, troubles, afflictions and\nmiseries.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Cl722meFEQk/WPugiEdvg3I/AAAAAAABS1o/Jg_3qEjtwXwuDe0R92XfbUFvRnADmiBuACLcB/s1600/i00mages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"257\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Cl722meFEQk/WPugiEdvg3I/AAAAAAABS1o/Jg_3qEjtwXwuDe0R92XfbUFvRnADmiBuACLcB/s400/i00mages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That noble man who has a clean and pure conscience is not afraid of\nanybody in this world. He is not afraid of death even.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A good, clear\nconscience is the temple of God. It helps the aspirant to reach the goal\nquickly. What good health is to the body a good conscience is to the soul.\nThere is inward satisfaction of conscience when a good action is done, when\nvirtue is practised, when you lead a virtuous life.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-iLiVkix95po/WPuf8Tpau4I/AAAAAAABS1c/GguMhN-3ZoE-Dlz-oqSsndJgFMOHGxyNACLcB/s1600/fd.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"263\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-iLiVkix95po/WPuf8Tpau4I/AAAAAAABS1c/GguMhN-3ZoE-Dlz-oqSsndJgFMOHGxyNACLcB/s400/fd.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The most natural beauty in\nthe world is honesty and moral truth. Be beautiful within. Have a clean\nconscience. Be virtuous. Physical beauty fades.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conscience or the voice\nof wisdom speaks in all of Lord\u2019s creation, but the little, finite, impure\nhuman intellect does not comprehend it.. The voice of the soul will lead you to\nsafety, truth, peace and immortal bliss. The moment we are awakened our\nconscience plays its most significant role. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-WaLnw2CBIiA/WPugTyOECiI/AAAAAAABS1k/2N3ykkPL37svxDZmEEDX6Y3vy2hl-DxKACLcB/s1600/image99s.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-WaLnw2CBIiA/WPugTyOECiI/AAAAAAABS1k/2N3ykkPL37svxDZmEEDX6Y3vy2hl-DxKACLcB/s400/image99s.jpg\" width=\"302\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The inner light\nconstantly inspires. Even now animal propensities quite often reign supreme in\nour human consciousness. But the inner light warns us not to go back to the\nanimal life. It tells us to stay at least in the human life proper. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Viveka is one of the four principles of Gyana\nYoga; discernment of the real and unreal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Viveka is the purest\nform of knowledge. It can also be described as the supreme authority of our\nconscience. &nbsp;Our conscience tells us what\nis right and what is wrong.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Mostly we know very well what we should do,\nhowever, our egoistic desires generally show themselves as stronger and drown\nthe voice of conscience within us.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through Viveka we are\nable to differentiate between truth and untruth, right and wrong, good and bad.\nViveka leads us to the knowledge that the material reality is relative, and\nguides our endeavours towards the Absolute, the Eternal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Our conscience tells us what is right and what\nis wrong. Mostly we know very well what we should do, however, our egoistic\ndesires generally show themselves as stronger and drown the voice of conscience\nwithin us.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-mwyxRmEckCE/WPugGr8rNAI/AAAAAAABS1g/_yiJra2N01gvTd-okwdCGHNAPen0U_CfgCLcB/s1600/fd.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"263\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-mwyxRmEckCE/WPugGr8rNAI/AAAAAAABS1g/_yiJra2N01gvTd-okwdCGHNAPen0U_CfgCLcB/s400/fd.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><b>SANATANA DHARMA DEMANDS\nTHAT A HINDU MUST EXERCISE HIS CONSCIENCE AT EVERY STEP IN HIS LIFE.&nbsp; </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">SANATANA DHARMA DEMAND NO SURRENDER\nTO RELIGIOUS DOGMA &nbsp;( NONE EXISTS ) LIKE SINGLE HOLY BOOK / SINGLE MESSIAH RELIGIONS.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-rmbsCFpHUdg/WPuhGsOPlEI/AAAAAAABS10/CZCh6TrWKfAVuNh-zcFYmptxLJkbPcGKgCLcB/s1600/immmages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"292\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-rmbsCFpHUdg/WPuhGsOPlEI/AAAAAAABS10/CZCh6TrWKfAVuNh-zcFYmptxLJkbPcGKgCLcB/s400/immmages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">NOW LET ME TALK BRIEFLY\nABOUT <span style=\"color: red;\">VAIRAGYA</span></b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vairagya means to\nliberate oneself inwardly from any desire for earthly pleasure or possessions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vairagya is detachment\nor dispassion from sense objects. An ascetic who has subdued all passions and\ndesires is called a vair\u0101gika..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a process of\ngently reducing the coloring of attractions and aversions in the inner field of\nmind.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This dispassion does not mean abandoning ones responsibilities to other\npeople or to fulfilling of ones duties to society at large.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Non-attachment\n(vairagya) is a&nbsp; natural byproduct of\ndiscrimination, there is an decrease in attraction to the objects of the world\nand the inner desires for those worldly fruits.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That which you reject\nas unnecessary, redundant, meaningless, an interference \u2013 that process of\nrejection is called vairagya. &nbsp;&nbsp;It\ninvolves dispassion, detachment, or renunciation, in particular renunciation\nfrom the pains and pleasures in the material world <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">True vairagya refers to\nan internal state of mind rather than to external lifestyle and can be\npracticed equally well by one engaged in family life and career as it can be by\na renunciate. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vairagya does not mean\nsuppression or developing repulsion for material objects.. Balance is\nmaintained between the inner spiritual state and one's external life through\nthe practice of seeing all limited entities as expressions of the one Cosmic\nConsciousness or Brahman. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The concept of Vair\u0101gya\nis found in the Yoga S\u016btras of Pata\u00f1jali, where it along with practice\n(abhy\u0101sa), is the key to restraint of the modifications of the mind (YS 1.12,\n\"abhy\u0101sa-vair\u0101gyabhy\u0101\u1e41 tannirodha\u1e25\"). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Non-attachment is a\nmajor foundation of Yoga, and is described in Yoga Sutras 1.12-1.15. 2.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The term vair\u0101gya\nappears three times in the Bhagavad Gita (6.35, 13.8, 18.52) where it is\nrecommended as a key means for bringing control to the restless mind.\n\"There are four stages in Vairagya:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(1) Yatamana:- This is\nan attempt not to allow the mind to run into sensual grooves;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(2) Vyatireka :-In this\nstage some objects are attracting you and you are endeavouring to cut off the\nattachment and attraction. Slowly Vairagya develops for these objects also.\nThen the Vairagya matures. When some objects tempt and delude you, you should\nruthlessly avoid them. You will have to develop Vairagya for these tempting\nobjects and it must also mature. In this stage you are conscious of your degree\nof Vairagya towards different objects;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(3) Ekendriya:-The\nsenses stand still and are subdued, but the mind has either Raga or Dvesha for\nobjects. Mind is, in other words, the only sense that functions independently;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(4) Vasirara :-The\nobjects no longer tempt you. They cause no attraction. The senses are perfectly\nquiet. The mind also is free from likes and dislikes (Raga and Dvesha). Then\nyou get supremacy or independence. Now you are conscious of your supremacy.\nWithout Vairagya no spiritual progress is possible.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(5) Paravairagya :-In\nthis highest stage of Vairagya. In this state, it is free from the qualities of\nthe gunas and the sadhaka no longer worried about himself.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vairagya is of three\nkinds viz., dull (Manda), intense (Tivra) and very intense (Tivratara). Dull\nVairagya cannot help you much in the attainment of your goal.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;One who has successfully cultivated\nnon-attachment is actually more effective in the world, as well as more\nprepared for the subtleties of seeking Truth. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Gyana Yogi has\nrealised that all worldly pleasures are unreal and are therefore without\nlasting value. A Gyana Yogi seeks the unchanging, the eternal Supreme - God.\nAll things of this earthly realm are transitory and therefore a form of\nunreality. Reality is the Atma, the Divine Self, which is indestructible,\neternal and unchanging. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vekachudamani morally\nright action (characterised as humbly and compassionately performing the primary\nduty of good to others without expectation of material or spiritual reward),\nhelps \"purify the heart\" and provide mental tranquility but it alone\ndoes not give us \"direct perception of the Reality\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: x-large;\">NEXT IS <b><span style=\"color: red;\">MUMUKSHUYVAM&nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b>THIS IS ABOUT MOKSHA -- REDUCING KARMIC BAGGAGE --&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<b><span style=\"background-color: white;\">NOT RUNNING AROUND LIKE A CUNTS BEATING DHOLAKS AND</span><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"> SINGING BHAKTI MOVEMENT BHAJANS</span><span style=\"background-color: white;\"> IN VERNACULAR --&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"background-color: white;\">OR SITTING LIKE AN ESCAPIST IN SOME OSHO ASHRAM OR MONK HOUSE OR YOUNG WOMEN WEARING WHITE SAREES AND <span style=\"color: red;\">ESCAPING FROM MARRIED FAMILY LIFE&nbsp;</span></span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-DIoeS60DkBI/WPwSJyBsGaI/AAAAAAABS3Y/QaAxay8ir5gBGHH-6Yt2vBUfLZ6kg3alACLcB/s1600/100308EE_womensday1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-nq144yzQhnY/WPwSpEPQeZI/AAAAAAABS3c/OcR8-o-ciasPV3wGjrZzPeaHrfcfpF-YQCLcB/s1600/SEhivani.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-nq144yzQhnY/WPwSpEPQeZI/AAAAAAABS3c/OcR8-o-ciasPV3wGjrZzPeaHrfcfpF-YQCLcB/s400/SEhivani.jpg\" width=\"316\" /></a></div>\n<b><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b><b><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">Above : There are different set of rules-- this young woman Shivani Verma woman above who comes on TV ( India Today TV ) early in the morning giving <span style=\"color: red;\">HAJAAAR bullshit funda </span>to Suresh Oberoi is married ..</span></span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"background-color: white;\">KARMA YOGI NIKOLA TESLA ( INVENTED AC ELECTRICITY/ &nbsp;AC MOTORS ) REDUCED HIS KARMIC BAGGAGE WITHOUT A SINGLE PRAYER&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1cmKtgJ0WkI/WPwRdmby68I/AAAAAAABS3Q/lPM4xX1LKpAMhM9hJsRqsjKQ9o6zcxEvgCLcB/s1600/55733-ktDDXhcbhnomt-1492079599.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1cmKtgJ0WkI/WPwRdmby68I/AAAAAAABS3Q/lPM4xX1LKpAMhM9hJsRqsjKQ9o6zcxEvgCLcB/s1600/55733-ktDDXhcbhnomt-1492079599.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<b><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"background-color: white;\">CHANAKYA GOT MOKSHA BY SAVING THE WATAN-- A ONE MAN SHOW</span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/chanakya-taxila-university-professor.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/chanakya-taxila-university-professor.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mumukshutvam means the\nburning desire for spiritual freedom. &nbsp;It\nis an intense, passionate, longing or desire for enlightenment and liberation\nfrom the levels of suffering that comes from the repeated cycles of suffering\nand delusion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Mumukshutva is\ncoupled with burning vairagya, self-realisation will come soon.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a longing that is\nso strong that it gradually swallows up all of the other, smaller desires. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mumukshutva is intense\ndesire for liberation or deliverance from the wheel of births and deaths with\nits concomitant evils of old age, disease, delusion and sorrow<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mind moves towards\nthe Source of its own accord when it has lost its charm for external objects. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It has no resting place\nin this objective universe. Purification of the mind and mental discipline form\nthe rock-bottom foundation of yoga. When this is effected, the longing for\nliberation dawns by itself.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you want a thing\nfrom the bottom of your heart, it will happen.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A complete detachment\nfrom the outward things, the manifold objects of senses, together with a\ncapacity for metaphysical abstraction and concentration on inward things are\ndemanded from an earnest seeker after truth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A hungry man, in order\nto satisfy himself, must eat. His hunger is not satisfied by watching another\neat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me attain MOKSHA.\nThis intense yearning is MUMUKSHUTHWA. The person yearning is called MUMUKSHU.&nbsp; A Mumukshu has a very clear goal. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A real Mumukshu does\nnot run away from the responsibilities of life. He does his work normally like\nany other but the only difference is the way he perceives the result of the\nwork done. He works whole heartedly than a person who is interested monetarily\nbut never allows the result to go to his head. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Endurance, courage,\naloofness, faith, conviction, willpower, and joyfulness are his strength to\nkeep him going in his path towards self-realization.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mumukshutva, the deep\ndesire to attain moksha, is the fundamental requirement for progress on the\npath of spirituality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Mumukshutva is wishing for the highest order,\nbecause once this is fulfilled thereafter is a state of desirelessness. All\nother desires lead to endless desires.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mumukshutva overpowers\nall other desires. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Vedanta, a burning\ndesire for liberation is considered one of the qualifications for\nenlightenment. It\u2019s called mumukshutva in Sanskrit. It is wanting liberation\nlike a drowning man wants his next breath. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adi Sankaracharya has\nmentioned four qualities: nitya-anitya vastu viveka, ihamutra-phalabhoga-viragah,\nshamadishatkasampattih and mumukshutva. --the last one, mumukshutva, means\n\u2018wanting it\u2019. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mumukshutva should be\nsteady, unflickering and of a burning type. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, the four step\npreparatory process is---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">viveka (discrimination\nof Real from unreal).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">vairagya (detachment or\ndispassion from sense objects)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">mumukshtva ( intense\ndesire to achieve permanent bliss).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sadhana chatushTaya\nis described by&nbsp;&nbsp; Adi Shankaracharua in\nViveka Chudamai is --<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adou nitya-anitya vastu\nvivEkah parigaNyatE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">iha-amutra phalabhOga\nvirAgah tadanantaram<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">shamAdi shatka\nsampittih mumukshatvam iti sphuTam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: great cosmic mind all pervading</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">Vibrations of Kama sprout from conscious thought</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">KAMA IS \"DESIRABLE ACTION\"</span></b> -- NOT FUCKING UP THE ASSHOLE OR CUNT</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nKAMA is one of the Puru\u1e63hartas for a Hindu \u2013 vital goals of human pursuit .</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nDharma, Artha and Kama. These three combined together are called Trivarga.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>KAMA is about the emotional and aesthetic values of the mind ( art / poetry / food for thought etc ) \u2013has nothing to with PRICK or TWAT.</b></span><br />\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nPurushartha and Ashrama Vyavastha are closely linked with each other. These help in the conduct of human activities leading towards Moksha</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nPurushartha means those actions which are proper and correct. The aim of life of an individual is determined by the doctrine of Purushartha. It also decides the course of life of man and lays down norms and values for the behaviour patterns.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nBy Purushartha we mean the pursuance of those actions which lead to the fulfillment of socially approved values and goal.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nSANATANA DHARMA WANTS MAN AND WOMAN TO MARRY AND PROCREATE</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nSANATANA DHARMA DOES NOT ALLOW MAN TO REMAIN SINGLE AND CALL HIMSELF A BRAHMACHARI \u2013THE WAY ROTHSCHILD USED GANDHI TO PROPAGATE ( WITHHOLDING SEMEN )..</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nGANDHI WAS MAKING MERRY WITH TEENAGED NAKED GIRLS ON HIS BED UNDER THE SAME BLANKET</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/01/mahatma-gandhi-and-his-endless.html</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_37BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; It means \"devoting oneself to Brahman\".</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nBrahmacharya is the virtue of celibacy when unmarried and fidelity when married. It represents a virtuous lifestyle that also includes simple living, meditation and other behaviors.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nBrahmacharyam means an overall lifestyle conducive to the pursuit of sacred knowledge and spiritual liberation. Brahmacharya is a means, not an end. It usually includes cleanliness, ahimsa, simple living, studies, meditation, and voluntary restraints on certain foods, intoxicants, and behaviors-(including sexual behavior.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nQUOTE : Now what people call yajna (sacrifice) is really Brahmacharya, for only by means of Brahmacharya does the knower attain that world (of Brahman). And what people call Ishta (worship) is really Brahmacharya, for only worshipping by means of Brahmacarya does one attain the Atman (the liberated Self).</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nNow, what people call the Sattrayana (sacrificial session) is really Brahmacharya, for only by means of Brahmacharya does one obtain one's salvation from Sat (Being). And what people call the Mauna (vow of silence) is really Brahmacharya for only through Brahmacharya does one understand the Atman and then meditate.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nNow, what people call a Anasakayana (vow of fasting) is really Brahmacharya, for this Atman never perishes which one attains by means of Brahmacharya. And what people call the Aranyayana (life of a hermit) is really Brahmacharya, for the world of Brahman belongs to those who by means of Brahmacharya attain the seas Ara and Nya in the world of Brahman. For them there is freedom in all the worlds.\u201d \u2014\u2009Chandogya Upanishad, VIII.5.1 - VIII.5. 5000 BC. Alexander the Great avoided them when he came to India 2400 years ago and he recorded them as MOUNTED ARCHERS\u2014who shot backwards while riding away at full speed\u2014turning at the waist.<br />\n<br />\nHAMARA POORA IMTIHAN LEGA KYA ?<br />\n<br />\nI SHALL RETAIN MONOPOLY OF JEW ROTHSCHILDs SIGNATURES . <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>&nbsp;In each mode the order of recital of the words\nis specified as a particular permutation of their original sequence. <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Here\nis a sentence from the Yajur veda, obviously without the svaras, in its\noriginal samhita pATha form, also its pada text and then the order of the words\nin the ghana recital. <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In &nbsp;Sanskrit the order of words does not matter.\nIf you do it with an English sentence like:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rama vanquished Ravana<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">It will go like this in\na mindless manner :<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rama vanquished\nvanquished Rama Rama vanquished Ravana \u2018Ravana vanquished Rama\u2019 Rama vanquished\nRavana \u2026 and so on.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Only STUPID languages\nlike English have Syntax<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">English is a language\nthat has a structure known as SVO.&nbsp; That\nis subject, verb and object.&nbsp; The cat\n(subject) washes (verb) its paw (object).&nbsp;\nThis is the correct word order and also there is agreement between the\nwords.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">If there were no\nagreement within the sentence, it could read, \u201cThe cat washes their paw\u201d.&nbsp; This does not make sense.&nbsp; The cat may have four paws, but it is only\nwashing one paw.&nbsp; For there to be\nagreement, the possessive \u2018it\u2019 has to be correct.&nbsp; Thus \u201cThe cats (plural) wash their (plural)\npaws (plural)\u201d.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Capt. Ajit Vadakayil<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>April 16, 2016 at 7:45 PM<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>S is the subject, V is the verb and O is the\nobject; the three exhaustive elements of a simple sentence.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Malayalam is subject\u2013object\u2013verb (SOV)\nlanguage is one in which the subject, object, and verb of a sentence appear or\nusually appear in that order.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>If English were SOV, \" Dick apple\nate\" would be an ordinary sentence, as opposed to the actual Standard English\n\" Dick ate apple\". Hindi is SOV.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Hebrew is subject\u2013verb\u2013object (SVO) is a\nsentence structure where the subject comes first, the verb second, and the\nobject third. English is SVO.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>BILBLICAL HEBREW WAS VSO LIKE CLASSICAL\nARABIC .<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>SANSKRIT IS THE MOTHER OF ALL LANGUAGES<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Simple sentences in Sanskrit do not need to\nfollow any specified structure. They are attached either to the subject or the\nobject in form of \u2018vibhakti\u2019.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Thus, in\nprinciple, every simple sentence in Sanskrit can be condensed into three\ndistinct words: the subject, the verb and the object.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We can write these three words in any order\nwe want (all 3! = 6 ways) and the sentence will bear the same meaning.&nbsp;&nbsp; A unique meaning.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Sanskrit like Malayalam is usually used in\nSOV format though.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Sanskrit's grammatical structure, words carry\nextra information with them. Because of this extra information, word order is\nmore flexible in Sanskrit than in English.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>IN STUPID ENGLISH BANANA CAN EAT ELEPHANT,\nWHICH CANNOT HAPPEN IN SANSKRIT.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Sanskrit, uses inflection to a great extent.\nIn Sanskrit, a complex idea can exist as one word and still carry a single and\nprecise meaning.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Malayalam and Hindi employs postpositions,\nwhereas English employs prepositions<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Term/Definition<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Grammar/The set of rules that describes or\ndefines a language<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Grammatical/used to describe an expression\nthat follows the rules of grammar.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Subject/ In a sentence, the thing that\nperforms an action<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Verb/ In a sentence, the word that describes\nthe action<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Object/ In a sentence, the thing that is\naffected by the action<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Emphasis/ a quality that tells us to pay\nattention to certain words<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Inflection/ the act of changing a word to\nfurther clarify its meaning<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>capt ajit vadakayil<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>..<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; text-decoration-line: none;\">April 23, 2017 at 7:14 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_11MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nALL BENAMI TV CHANNELS ARE RIDICULING TAMIL NADU \" ABSURD WAY OF SAVING WATER\"<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: purple;
